Gearing Your Business Up For Marketing Automation

July 2013 Insight

As a smaller software business, you will appreciate how valuable it would be to your business to havequalified hot' sales leads delivered to your desktop every day. There are no excuses now to be chasing half baked leads that don't come to anything. Our lead generation managed service is powered by a sophisticated marketing automation tool that will deliver real-time hot' prospects to your sales people.

There are a number of things that a smaller software business will need to consider in order to adopt marketing automation as part of a lead generation managed service. This month's insight will focus on what you need to do to get your business ready for marketing automation.

We have outlined some key areas below that will help your business have a smooth transition into marketing automation. We know ourselves having gone through the process last year that it's incredibly important to look at the following before you embark on this exciting venture:

How is your data looking?

In order to drive your marketing emails to the right target audience you need a good database. Your efforts will be lost if your data is out of date and the majority of your email addresses are generic. We would recommend that your data is held in a CRM system rather than in Outlook or Excel. CRM systems hold real-time data that is constantly and easily updated, not only that, when integrated with your marketing automation software it will give you a single integrated sales platform delivering the hottest sales leads to your sales team.

Think content, think curiosity

Think about the content of your marketing collateral. It is time to make every effort to ensure that all of your marketing communications have compelling content. In order to generate curiosity with prospects you need to deliver interesting and enticing content. Your goal is to capture prospects through registrations to your website and newsletters. Once they have registered, then you can begin nurturing that prospect through timely emails that are triggered based on their online behaviour and activity. Marketing automation gives you total visibility.

Social media it's compulsory now!

Be active on social media. All businesses should be using social media to promote themselves. We would recommend that smaller software businesses should be using Twitter, LinkedIn and be writing a regular blog. Most of the social media tools out there can be integrated with your marketing automation software, so get tweeting and update your status with relevant and interesting content all of the time. It's not the time to be half-hearted about spreading the word.

Think conversions

Are you using Pay Per Click advertising? Think about your landing pages, how do they look to a prospective customer? Remember, someone who has come to your website through a Pay Per Click advert is there because they are actively looking for your product or service. Once they have landing on your page your goal is to capture their details so you can begin to nurture them from warm' to hot' based on what it is they are interested in. Think about what you are advertising and design impressive landing pages so that people don't just disappear back into the abyss of the web.

Our new Lead Generation Managed Service....

Our new lead generation managed service is designed to help smaller software businesses by managing the entire process and generating qualified sales leads. Using our in-house marketing knowledge and expertise combined with revolutionary marketing automation tools that give you total visibility of the lead nurturing process, our lead generation service will help you engage and educate, nurture and qualifyand most importantly sell and close.
